recipes.title: Scallops with Pea Puree and Vermouth Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Tramin Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tramin Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Bright yellow in color with coppery reflections and clear fruit aromas of pear, citrus, honeysuckle, tropical fruits and light spices. Firm, velvety and rich on the palate, with well-integrated acidity. A very round and satisfying wine. Recommended with fish antipasti, risotto with asparagus, omelets and pasta

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            In small saucepan, cover peas with a minimum of water.  Bring to a boil and cook 2 minutes, then transfer peas to blender, reserving cooking liquid. Add half of butter to blender along with 6 tablespoons cooking liquid, or more as needed. Puree until smooth and relatively thick, about 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon butter over high heat until foam subsides. Season scallops with salt and pepper and cook until golden and just cooked though, 2-3 minutes per side. Spread pea puree amongst 4 plates and top with cooked scallops.                                                                                                                             3                                                                            Pour out excess butter from pan. Add vermouth to pan and turn heat to high; boil vigorously for 30 seconds then add remaining tablespoon butter and reduce further until syrupy. Pour sauce on scallops and top with pea shoots.

steps.step: In small saucepan, cover peas with a minimum of water.  Bring to a boil and cook 2 minutes, then transfer peas to blender, reserving cooking liquid.

In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon butter over high heat until foam subsides. Season scallops with salt and pepper and cook until golden and just cooked though, 2-3 minutes per side.
Spread pea puree amongst 4 plates and top with cooked scallops.
Pour out excess butter from pan.
Add vermouth to pan and turn heat to high; boil vigorously for 30 seconds then add remaining tablespoon butter and reduce further until syrupy.
